messages: f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (22:59): I wonder how many (rough %) html documents on the Web have
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (22:59): 1. "no title" and a "h1"
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (22:59): 2. "title" but no "h1"
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (22:59): 3. "title" and "h1"
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (22:59): 4. none (no "title", no "h1")

78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (23:02): If I didn't know better f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb, I think you were trying to queue up some processes for 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2's data scouting engine.
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (23:02): What do you want to know for? :-)
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (23:13): I was wondering if in the absence of title we could use h1 for the document title. It bugged me that people had always to put title and h1 in some cases.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (23:13): plus an h1 would be "easier" to maintain. DRY
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (23:14): just random thoughts, but that might create additional issues as always :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:14): Anolis has <!--title--> just for that use-case
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (23:21): no h1 and no title: 2628
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (23:25): Add them all up :-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (23:25): But there's no bot here to do that for me!
78885357e970c69de0c33081760a04c9 (23:25): okay, didn't know if there was any misc errors. :-)
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (23:25): and if you don't get 126989 them my maths is horribly wrong
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (23:26): I tried download 131072 pages, and then excluded errors and non-text/html
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (23:32): interesting
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (23:32): so basically it would not do a lot of harm
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (23:32): if it was decided to make h1 equivalent of title when title is not in the document
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (23:35): It wouldn't do a lot of good either, because pretty much everybody already uses title
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (23:35): It's the third most common element, after html and head which every single document has because they're added automatically by the parser :-)
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (23:35): yes that's cool.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (23:36): but imagine that the browser takes h1 for the title of the window and for bookmarking.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (23:36): I guess many h1 are a substring of title. or maybe not
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (23:36): hmmm still thinking

0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (23:50): Title: Goodbye IBM ´ Access Garage (at accessgarage.wordpress.com)

f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (23:51): "This came as shock to me today, but I was just laid off from IBM. It was not a result of performance. They tell me it was because ARIA and working with external browser vendors is no longer a priority."
